CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 2, 1939, pg. 9, reads: "Principals In Coward-Harshaw Wedding - Cameraman Harris was on hand last Tuesday evining [evening] at 7:30 to snap the above photograph of principals in Norma Coward-Ernest Harshaw wedding party, just after the ceremony was performed by the Rev. B.S. Mason. Reading left to right: Miss Virella Anthony, bridesmaid; Miss Vera Coward, sister of the bride, who was maid of honor; Charles Davis, grandfather of the bride, who gave her away; the groom, Ernest Harshaw; his bride; Louis Fulton, best man; Reginald Burruss, the groomsman, who was also soloist for the evening, and L. Sawyer, groomsman.  The newlyweds will honeymoon for a week and then be  at home at 7222 Monticello street to friends"
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Coward - Harshaw wedding party, from left: Virella Anthony, maid of honor Vera Coward, bride's grandfather Charles Davis, groom Ernest Harshaw, bride Norma Coward Harshaw, best man Louis Fulton, Reginald Burruss, and L. Sawyer, posed in domestic interior with floral wallpaper, striped curtains, and ferns
